TIK Cheatsheet

This cheatsheet will help you write textual internationalization keys (TIKs) in the default setting for locale en.

{"..."} String

Replaces ... with an arbitrary string value.

ExampleAvoid comparing {"apples"} to {"oranges"}.
ICUAvoid comparing {var0} to {var1}
  • {"var0": "cats üêà", "var1": "dogs üêï"}
    ‚Üí
    Avoid comparing cats üêà to dogs üêï
  • {"var0": "bananas", "var1": "anything really"}
    ‚Üí
    Avoid comparing bananas to anything really

{"2 ..."} Cardinal Pluralization

Pluralizes ... to the correct CLDR plural form.

ExampleYou have {2 unread messages} in {2 groups}.
ICUYou have {var0, plural, one{# unread message} other{# unread messages}} in {var1, plural, one{# group} other{# groups}}}
  • {"var0": 4, "var1": 1}
    ‚Üí
    You have 4 unread messages in 1 group
  • {"var0": 1, "var1": 1}
    ‚Üí
    You have 1 unread message in 1 group

{4th} Ordinal Pluralization

Represents a CLDR ordinal plural value.

ExampleYou are {4th} in the queue.
ICUYou are {var0, selectordinal, one{#st} two{#nd} few{#rd} other{#th}} in the queue.
  • {"var0": 1}
    ‚Üí
    You are 1st in the queue.
  • {"var0": 9}
    ‚Üí
    You are 9th in the queue.

{They} Gender

Represents a gender subject.

them
their
theirs
themself
Example{They} received the message!
ICU{var0, select, male{He} female{She} other{They}} received the message!
  • {"var0": "male"}
    ‚Üí
    He received the message
  • {"var0": "female"}
    ‚Üí
    She received the message
  • {"var0": "neutral"}
    ‚Üí
    They received the message
  • TIK's magic constants (and any of their variants) are case insensitive.
  • ICU Message Format
